comment.text: This translation key is used to display the "Valid until" date of an LDAP certificate. It appears in a Certificate Dialog on the Portal Settings page and is part of a list of certificate details.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation "صالح حتى تاريخ" (Saalih hatta tareekh) literally translates to "Valid until date." It lacks the article 'the' which would make it more accurate to the English 'Valid until'.

The Azerbaijani translation 'qədər etibarlıdır' doesn't accurately convey the meaning of 'Valid until'. It literally translates to 'is valid until', which isn't the intended nuance. The phrase 'Valid until' implies a deadline or expiration date.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: A more accurate translation would be something like 'bitərəfçilikə qədər etibarlıdır' (valid until impartiality), 'bitirməyə qədər etibarlıdır' (valid until completion), or simply 'bitərəfçilikə etibarlıdır' (valid until impartiality). The best option depends on the context of 'Ldap:LdapSettingsValidUntil'.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Finnish translation "Voimassa " does not accurately convey the meaning of "Valid until". "Voimassa" translates to "in force" or "valid", but lacks the temporal aspect of "until".
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Päiväys voimassa - until date or Voimassa asti - valid until

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While "有効期限" (yuukou kigen) is a common term for 'valid until' or 'expiration date', it lacks the nuance of 'until' in the context of a setting. It implies a hard deadline, whereas 'valid until' might allow for adjustments or extensions.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider alternatives like "有効期限まで" (yuukou kigen made) or a more descriptive phrase depending on the specific functionality of the setting. If an actual expiration date is meant, then the current translation is acceptable.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Korean translation "유효 기간 끝" (yu-hyo gi-gan kkeut) translates to "end of validity period" which is a more literal and less natural way to say "Valid until". A more appropriate translation would focus on the 'until' aspect.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: 유효 기간까지 (yu-hyo gi-gan kkaji) - 'until validity period'

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Lao translation 'ຫມາຍເລກໃຊ້ໄດ້ເຖິງ' translates more to 'number valid until' or 'applicable until a number'. It doesn't accurately convey the meaning of 'Valid until'. The intended meaning is a date or a time period.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: ຫມາຍເລກໃຊ້ໄດ້ເຖິງວັນທີ

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'වලංගු වනතුරු' while potentially conveying a sense of validity ending, isn't the most natural or precise translation of 'Valid until'. It leans towards 'validity continues until'. A more accurate translation would better reflect the meaning of 'Valid until' indicating a deadline or expiry date.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider alternatives like 'පාය තැබිලි දක්වා' (paya thabawili dakawa) - 'until a specified date', or 'අවලංගු වනු දක්වා' (awalangu vanu dakawa) - 'until it becomes invalid' depending on the specific context of the Ldap settings.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'Validno do' doesn't accurately convey the meaning of 'Valid until'. 'Validno' translates to 'valid' but in this context, a more appropriate translation would convey the concept of expiration or a deadline.

The translation 'Şu tarihe kadar geçerlidir' is a descriptive phrase meaning 'Valid until [date]'. While it conveys a similar idea, it's not a direct translation of 'Valid until'. A more direct, and commonly used translation would be 'Geçerlilik tarihi'.

While "Có hiệu lực đến" is understandable, it's not the most natural or accurate translation of "Valid until" in this context. It implies something is 'in effect until'. A better translation would convey the end date or expiration date of the LDAP settings.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider alternatives like "Hết hạn" (Expires) or "Thời gian hiệu lực đến" (Effective until)
